intro: Modanthos prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate modanthos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are adapted to conserve water, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, which is characterized by succulent leaves and showy flowers.
